title: Symantec investigating certain accounting measures
text:
May 14, 2018 / 8:50 PM / Updated an hour ago Symantec investigating certain accounting measures Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
(Reuters) - Symantec Corp ( SYMC.O ) said on Monday it is investigating the reporting of certain accounting measures including those that could impact executive compensation and some forward-looking statements, but added it does not see a material impact on its past financial statements from the probe. The Symantec logo is pictured on a screen June 13, 2016. REUTERS/Thomas White/File Photo
The Norton anti-virus maker said the investigation, which commenced following “concerns” raised by a former employee, will also look into stock trading plans and the company’s public disclosures including commentary on historical financial results.
Chief Executive Officer Gregory Clark on an investor call said the company has put on hold all discretionary and performance-based compensation for named executive officers until the investigation concludes.
When asked for more details, Clark said he “can’t answer any questions about the investigation.”
The company said its audit committee had hired an independent counsel and other advisers to assist in the investigation.
The Norton anti-virus maker’s shares, which closed up about 10 percent in regular trading, rose marginally in extended trading.
About $6 billion in market value was wiped out on Friday, a day after the company disclosed the whistleblower probe in its quarterly earnings report without providing further details. Reporting by Munsif Vengattil and Laharee Chatterjee in Bengaluru; Editing by Sriraj Kalluvila
